text: Center farmer leadership and codify equity clauses in the text of the Accord; time the hard asks to real policy windows so power actually shifts. Non-negotiables are explicit: opt-in consent in Lusoga with a simple path to withdraw at any time; community oversight, public noticeboards, and simple grievance channels; elected, voting representation for women and youth on site committees; and transparent weighing with calibrated scales and moisture meters. Stakeholder pathway: accept the priest’s neutral venue with a clear non-partisan ground rule; sequence quiet diplomacy before public statements to reduce defensiveness; and pre-brief brokers and truckers on how the Accord preserves lawful income pathways. Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices; WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking; and traffic and wait-time logs for trucks to evidence bottlenecks and queuing fairness. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, and attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, and we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Prioritize procedure and templates to reduce friction, but note this only partially shifts power; avoid performative wins that ignore consent. Non-negotiables are explicit: no exclusivity and no single-buyer lock-in at parish points; transparent weighing with calibrated scales and moisture meters; community oversight, public noticeboards, and simple grievance channels; and paper and USSD options alongside any private app, with parity of access. Stakeholder pathway: anchor asks to LC3 agenda windows so farmer representatives speak from the front; pre-brief brokers and truckers on how the Accord preserves lawful income pathways; and publish short 'you said / we did' updates in Lusoga as voice notes and posters. Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on LC3 minutes, councillor commitments, and follow-up actions tracked openly; parish price series comparing buyer offers to observed floor prices; and calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, and misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Center farmer leadership and codify equity clauses in the text of the Accord; time the hard asks to real policy windows so power actually shifts. Non-negotiables are explicit: opt-in consent in Lusoga with a simple path to withdraw at any time; myth-busting facts on warehouse receipts to counter WhatsApp rumors; no exclusivity and no single-buyer lock-in at parish points; and clear storage safety measures, WASH checks, and incident logging. Stakeholder pathway: offer formal recognition and basic OSH for youth shellers to reduce precarity; invite rival councillors to co-chair a neutral dialogue before tensions harden; and accept the priest’s neutral venue with a clear non-partisan ground rule. Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices; LC3 minutes, councillor commitments, and follow-up actions tracked openly; and calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Make pragmatic trades that never cross red lines on consent, inclusion, or representation; sequence steps to keep donors aligned on pacing and optics. Stakeholder pathway: invite rival councillors to co-chair a neutral dialogue before tensions harden; negotiate donor pacing without optics theatre or press events that inflame politics; and pre-brief brokers and truckers on how the Accord preserves lawful income pathways. Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on traffic and wait-time logs for trucks to evidence bottlenecks and queuing fairness; analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices; and parish price series comparing buyer offers to observed floor prices. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Stakeholder pathway: pre-brief brokers and truckers on how the Accord preserves lawful income pathways; invite rival councillors to co-chair a neutral dialogue before tensions harden; and accept the priest’s neutral venue with a clear non-partisan ground rule. Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps; WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking; and protocol adherence checks on weighing procedures and tamper seals on scales. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, and misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps; WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking; and analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, and donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, and election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, and spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps; protocol adherence checks on weighing procedures and tamper seals on scales; and anonymized incident logs documented with informed consent and withdrawal rights. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, and election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, and misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps; parish price series comparing buyer offers to observed floor prices; and analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, and donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on anonymized incident logs documented with informed consent and withdrawal rights; WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking; and traffic and wait-time logs for trucks to evidence bottlenecks and queuing fairness. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, and election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps; adoption metrics for USSD, paper, and app pathways disaggregated by gender and age; and traffic and wait-time logs for trucks to evidence bottlenecks and queuing fairness. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, and election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on protocol adherence checks on weighing procedures and tamper seals on scales; calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps; and WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, and attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on parish price series comparing buyer offers to observed floor prices; anonymized incident logs documented with informed consent and withdrawal rights; and WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, and attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on adoption metrics for USSD, paper, and app pathways disaggregated by gender and age; WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking; and parish price series comparing buyer offers to observed floor prices. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, and donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on parish price series comparing buyer offers to observed floor prices; traffic and wait-time logs for trucks to evidence bottlenecks and queuing fairness; and adoption metrics for USSD, paper, and app pathways disaggregated by gender and age. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, and spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on anonymized incident logs documented with informed consent and withdrawal rights; calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps; and adoption metrics for USSD, paper, and app pathways disaggregated by gender and age. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, and election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Stakeholder pathway: accept the priest’s neutral venue with a clear non-partisan ground rule; anchor asks to LC3 agenda windows so farmer representatives speak from the front; and offer formal recognition and basic OSH for youth shellers to reduce precarity. Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on adoption metrics for USSD, paper, and app pathways disaggregated by gender and age; calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps; and parish price series comparing buyer offers to observed floor prices. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, and misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on adoption metrics for USSD, paper, and app pathways disaggregated by gender and age; parish price series comparing buyer offers to observed floor prices; and WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, and spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices; WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking; and calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Stakeholder pathway: anchor asks to LC3 agenda windows so farmer representatives speak from the front; negotiate donor pacing without optics theatre or press events that inflame politics; and sequence quiet diplomacy before public statements to reduce defensiveness. Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices; protocol adherence checks on weighing procedures and tamper seals on scales; and traffic and wait-time logs for trucks to evidence bottlenecks and queuing fairness. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, and donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on LC3 minutes, councillor commitments, and follow-up actions tracked openly; protocol adherence checks on weighing procedures and tamper seals on scales; and adoption metrics for USSD, paper, and app pathways disaggregated by gender and age. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on LC3 minutes, councillor commitments, and follow-up actions tracked openly; anonymized incident logs documented with informed consent and withdrawal rights; and adoption metrics for USSD, paper, and app pathways disaggregated by gender and age. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, and misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, and donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on protocol adherence checks on weighing procedures and tamper seals on scales; WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking; and calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, and donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on adoption metrics for USSD, paper, and app pathways disaggregated by gender and age; traffic and wait-time logs for trucks to evidence bottlenecks and queuing fairness; and LC3 minutes, councillor commitments, and follow-up actions tracked openly. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, and election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on anonymized incident logs documented with informed consent and withdrawal rights; WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking; and analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps; anonymized incident logs documented with informed consent and withdrawal rights; and analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, and donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Stakeholder pathway: anchor asks to LC3 agenda windows so farmer representatives speak from the front; offer formal recognition and basic OSH for youth shellers to reduce precarity; and publish short 'you said / we did' updates in Lusoga as voice notes and posters. Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on LC3 minutes, councillor commitments, and follow-up actions tracked openly; traffic and wait-time logs for trucks to evidence bottlenecks and queuing fairness; and calibrated moisture readings recorded per batch with meter IDs and timestamps. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, and we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on parish price series comparing buyer offers to observed floor prices; protocol adherence checks on weighing procedures and tamper seals on scales; and LC3 minutes, councillor commitments, and follow-up actions tracked openly. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, and misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Donor fluency: we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Stakeholder pathway: offer formal recognition and basic OSH for youth shellers to reduce precarity; invite rival councillors to co-chair a neutral dialogue before tensions harden; and pre-brief brokers and truckers on how the Accord preserves lawful income pathways. Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices; protocol adherence checks on weighing procedures and tamper seals on scales; and LC3 minutes, councillor commitments, and follow-up actions tracked openly. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, and attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Stakeholder pathway: invite rival councillors to co-chair a neutral dialogue before tensions harden; offer formal recognition and basic OSH for youth shellers to reduce precarity; and negotiate donor pacing without optics theatre or press events that inflame politics. Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices; anonymized incident logs documented with informed consent and withdrawal rights; and adoption metrics for USSD, paper, and app pathways disaggregated by gender and age. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, and misinformation spikes on WhatsApp about warehouse receipts and grain seizure, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on parish price series comparing buyer offers to observed floor prices; LC3 minutes, councillor commitments, and follow-up actions tracked openly; and analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for spoiler behavior from rival councillors seeking credit rather than solutions, and election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we reframe success around locally owned systems, not short-term visibility, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Evidence and learning are coalition-owned and light-touch, focusing on WASH spot checks for storage, including latrines, handwashing, and safe stacking; analysis of the proposed one-percent levy and its pass-through effect on farmgate prices; and anonymized incident logs documented with informed consent and withdrawal rights. Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and election-period crowd limits and safety wording to avoid provocation, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, and we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Risk posture is calm and adaptive, watching for attempts to reinsert exclusivity or app-only provisions through late amendments, and donor pressure for speed that could compromise consent or inclusion, with pre-agreed messaging and meeting formats. Donor fluency: we avoid public ceremonies; document progress through community-owned evidence briefs, and we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.

Donor fluency: we time tranche releases to verified community milestones rather than calendar optics, and we use micro-grants with tiny ledgers that parish groups can administer directly, ensuring parish groups retain control over decisions and data. If late amendments try to reinsert exclusivity, app-only gates, or non-voting seats, we escalate only through local chairs, bring the evidence brief to the LC3, and invite co-chairs to read the exact clauses aloud in Lusoga so the community understands the stakes. We keep a simple 'you said / we did' record in public view, rotate women and youth voices as the main spokespeople, and use the priest’s neutral venue with firm non-partisan guardrails.
